DataElement.preferredDefinition: Unique number assigned to an individual patient by the central registry.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Unique number assigned to an individual patient by the central registry.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Record; anything, e.g. a document, providing permanent evidence of or information about past events.:Identified; having the identity known or established.

Concepts.definition: Anything (e.g., a document) providing permanent evidence of or information about past events.
The procedure of having an identity established.

Property.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the identification of patients' medical records and forms.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The unique number assigned to an individual patient by the central tumor registry.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR, V 11.1 Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 11.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (5/4/06)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient ID Number Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: The central registry will assign this same number to all of the patient's subsequent tumors (records). Patient ID Number will only differ when multiple central registries accession the same patient. Each central registry will assign their unique Patient ID Number. NAACCR recommends that the registry should not reissue or reuse this number when a patient's record is deleted from the files. In the transmit file (data exchange) this number will be the Patient ID Number assigned by the sending registry as defined in Registry ID [40].
